label1.label: v0.0.4 - 16.04.2013 - BETA
label1.comment: This Magento module automatically sends a feedback request email to customers who have placed an order. The email includes a list of products last purchased with a link to the review page for each product. The module utilises the Magento scheduling service which requires a cron job to execute the Magento cron.php script at regular intervals. Please visit blog.gaiterjones.com for full documentation for this extension.

email_text1.label: Email body content:
email_text1.comment: Text for the main part of the feedback request email.

email_text2.label: Email footer content:
email_text2.comment: Text for the footer of the feedback request email.

email_subject.label: Subject text for the feedback email:
email_subject.comment: Subject text for email, if left blank defaults to "FOOTER LINK TEXT : Your Order # ORDERNUMBER".

email_footer_link.label: Email footer link text:
email_footer_link.comment: Text for email footer i.e. store name link, leave blank for no footer link.

max_feedback_items.label: Maximum number of cart items to request feadback for:
max_feedback_items.comment: Max number of items to include in email for feedback, default is all cart items from last order.

email_feedback_icon.label: Leave feedback icon URL:
email_feedback_icon.comment: URL to use for a Leave Feedback icon, if blank text will be used.

elapsed_time_from_order.label: When an order is placed send a feedback request email :
elapsed_time_from_order.comment: Select when feedback request emails should be sent.

check_order_status.label: Check order status:
check_order_status.comment: Check order status and only send feedback request email when order status is complete.

bcc_emails_enabled.label: BCC Copy Emails enabled:
bcc_emails_enabled.comment: Set to YES customer feedback emails will be blind copied to the general store contact email address.

test_mode_enabled.label: Test mode enabled:
test_mode_enabled.comment: Set to YES emails will be sent to store general address, enabled by default for testing, if set to NO emails will be sent to customer.

url_tracking_tags.label: URL Tracking tags:
url_tracking_tags.comment: Insert tracking tags here that will be appended to leave feedback links, i.e. Google UTM tags. It could look something like '?utm_source=GetCustomerFeedback &utm_medium=Email&utm_campaign=MyCampaign'

send_alert_email.label: Send alert emails:
send_alert_email.comment: Send emails to the Magento general email address when errors are detected, enabled by default for testing.
